articles.title: Video: 3D-printed humanoid robot made in just $70 with lifelike arms, chatbot brain
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: Alana is an open-source humanoid robot with movable arms powered by custom servo motors capable of lifting 500 grams at full extension. It is fully 3D-printed and controlled. It's attracting attention in the maker community for its affordability and functionality.

articles.title: AI is eroding what Reddit says is the site's greatest competitive advantage
articles.author: system
articles.summary: AI bots are threatening Reddit's advantage by taking over forums and comments. Reddit's human-led communities are what set the company apart, according to CEO Steve Huffman. Reddit has acknowledged the problem and said that the world needs community and shared knowledge, and that's what Reddit does best.

articles.title: Nvidia may have made these changes in its most powerful AI chip for China to avoid US export controls
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Nvidia is preparing to launch a modified version of the H20 AI chip for China within the next two months. The move comes after recent US export restrictions effectively effectively stopped the company from selling the chip in the US market.   nvidia has made changes to its AI chip.

articles.title: How to unlock AI's industrial value while managing its risks
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: 88% of senior leaders whose firms invest in AI now spend at least 5% of their total budgets on these initiatives. Half of them plan to dedicate 25% or more in the coming year. EY survey was conducted on behalf of its clients.

articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: Zencoder launches Zen Agents, the first AI platform enabling teams to create, share, and leverage custom development assistants organization-wide. Zen Agents also offers an open-source marketplace for enterprise-grade AI tools.       .   for business.

articles.author: Information Week
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence needs lots of power as it ingests data and produces results. Nuclear energy is ready to help artificial intelligence.    nuke energy is available to power artificial intelligence using nuclear energy.  nukes are ready to power AI with nuclear power.

articles.title: Doing More With Less: The Rise And Risks Of The Solo Marketer
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Back in 2010 CMOs were expected to know it all. With AI, they are expected to do it all, as well. CMO's need to be able to do everything, as they are no longer expected to be the only one in charge.

articles.title: Huawei introduces cloud-boosted AI to deliver seamless education in Zambia
articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: Chinese telecoms firm Huawei announced introduction of cloud-enhanced artificial intelligence technology to Zambia to provide seamless access to education in unserved areas. Huawei's vice president for the sub-Saharan African region said the technology offers transformative solutions and makes learning more personalized.

articles.author: Forbes

articles.title: Hill Roundtable: What's next for AI infrastructure
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: The executive summary from a roundtable breakfast focused on the integration and implementation of artificial intelligence into our everyday lives. Participants cautioned against oversimplifying AI as "magic" and emphasized the need to be cautious about overcomplicating AI's capabilities.

articles.title: New AI George Washington exhibit rides into Raynham Hall Museum in Oyster Bay
articles.author: Raynham Hall
articles.summary: Raynham Hall Museum unveiled a 3D digital rendering of George Washington on April 24. It's hailed as one of the most realistic digital representations of the first U.S. president ever created. The debut featured a public demonstration of the AI, which speaks to visitors, offers reflections on the founding of the nation and takes audience questions.

articles.title: Opinion: The Midwest can do AI right
articles.author: Thomas Douglas
articles.summary: In the next couple of years, we're going to build datasets that tell our story. We'll train models on what 'good' looks like and 'never'. We need to train our AI with Midwest values: community over competition, hard work, integrity, neighborliness and honesty. SMBs in the 417 are the perfect test beds for people-first AI.

articles.title: Kelly cosponsors bill to raise awareness about AI
articles.author: STAFF REPORT
articles.summary: The Artificial Intelligence Public Awareness and Education Campaign Act is from U.S. Sens. Todd Young, R-Idaho, and Brian Schatz, D-Hawaii. It requires the commerce secretary to operate a campaign about the benefits and risks of AI and educate Americans on how much AI is involved in their daily lives.

articles.title: Terry College: AI Art May Lead to More Lawsuits
articles.author: Merritt Melancon
articles.summary: Mike Schuster and Joseph Avery studied the public's perception of AI-generated art. They found people are more likely to see references to other artists' styles as copyright infringements when the image was generated by AI than when it was created by a human graphic designer. Their findings will be published in the University of California Irvine Law Review.

articles.title: Shaq-backed Education Startup Opens Atlanta Hub with Plans to Employ 250
articles.summary: Shaquille O'Neal and Sam Altman are behind Campus, an accredited, two-year, for-profit college that is trying to change how community college works in the U.S. Campus is slated to create hundreds of jobs in the city of Atlanta.
